revised_title: High Resolution Solar Ultraviolet Spectrum Between 200 and 220 nm
tldr: This article discusses a high-resolution solar ultraviolet spectrum recorded between 200 and 220 nm using an echelle spectrograph launched in a sun-pointing Skylark rocket. The data is analyzed and presented, revealing a broad absorption feature at 212.4 nm and a discontinuity in the continuum intensity near 208.7 nm. The findings contribute to the understanding of the solar spectrum and the development of astronomical instruments.
